Amsterdam trip ideas from experts and travellers

div.a: Holiday Inn Express Newcastle Metro Centre in Newcastle upon Tyne

li.span: "A retro haven amongst the bustle of the Asian district. Very friendly and clearly had a genuine love of food! Definitely worth a visit!"

"We were staying in Amsterdam for 3 nights. Out looking for a restaurant one night with map in hand and person asked if they could help us. Well turned out this fine person owned this wonderful establishment that we would try later that evening. On our way back from dinner we stopped at Sugar N Ice. ..." Sooo, glad we did. My husband had waffles with 3 types of ice cream on top and I had 3 scoops in a cup. Soo many wonderful flavors to choose from. The next night we stopped again and chose 3 more different flavors. The owner and his wife are so pleasant and you could see how he enjoyed his ice cream making business. He explained that he makes the ice cream right on premises. Wish we had been staying longer, could have tried more flavors, they all looked so appetizing. We have been to Rome and let me tell you this ice cream topped anything we had in Rome. Thank you for the directions and thank you for making a wonderful ice cream treat to enjoy in Amsterdam. Great price too. Maybe you cou... " More >

"We were looking for somewhere to eat when we came across this cafÃ©. People were sitting outside and it looked inviting. We checked out the menu and it had sandwiches, appetizers, entrees, something for everyone. We decided to get the cheese appetizer, plenty for 2 of us we it could have been an appe ..." tizer for four. We both had BLT's not what you see in the US, these were served on great rolls with lettuce, fresh green peppers, tomato and the most wonderful tasting bacon. We both tried the Bovaria Beer. We enjoyed our meal so much we returned the next night. This time my husband had the cheese, ham and pineapple sandwich, he said it was really good and I had that BLT again because I enjoyed it so much the night before. As I said you could have steak, lasagna all you could eat pawns etc. The menu was varied and inexpensive to boot. We did eat inside because it was so warm outside but at least you had the option of either. Prices are great and the service was very attentive. If we returne... " More >
